results.title: Another Country
results.creator_credit: Marek Kanievska, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Castlezone
results.brief_description: Guy Bennett is nearing the end of his last year at a leading English boarding school. His best friend, Tommy Judd, is a Marxist, committed to Lenin’s brave new world. In a school permeated by homosexuality, affairs between the boys are accepted, provided discretion is practised. Bennett breaks this unwritten rule and the humiliating consequences establish within him a rejection of the system that excludes him. Scripted by Julian Mitchell from his own play.

results.title: Annie Oakley
results.creator_credit: George Stevens, Cliff Reid and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Oscar nominee Barbara Stanwyck stars as Annie Oakley, an Ohio backwoods girl who sets her sights on adventure and romance as the Wild West’s legendary lady sharpshooter. She first gains prominence when she enters a local exhibition with Tony Walker (Preston Foster) who claims to be the world’s greatest marksman and the star of Buffalo Bill’s wild west show. Annie joins the show and soon becomes his star attraction, vying for attention with Toby whom she loves. After the mandatory period of professional rivalry and romantic conflict, they are finally united by a marksman superior to both of them, Cupid.

results.title: Annie Hall
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Woody Allen’s satire on the comic anxiety between the sexes in contemporary relationships. When Alvy Singer (Woody Allen), a neurotic night-club comedian, meets Annie Hall (Diane Keaton), a budding cabaret singer, a nervous romance begins. Also stars Colleen Dewhurst

results.title: Annie
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Ray Stark and Rastar Films
results.brief_description: Annie (Aileen Quinn) makes several unsuccessful attempts to flee the orphange where she lives, run by the alcoholic Miss Hannigan (played to comic perfection by Carol Burnett). With her dog, Sandy, and a cheerful attitude however, life is bearable. Annie’s dream of living with a real family is fulfilled when she is adopted by the billionaire “Daddy” Warbucks (Albert Finney). Her new lifestyle doesn’t run smoothly when Miss Hannigan, eager to get her hands on some of the Warcbuck fortune plots to kidnap Annie. It’s up to Annie’s friends from the orphanage to try and save her! Based on the Broadway musical and “Little orphan Annie” comic strip by Harold Gray, this film includes the hit songs “It’s a hard knock life” and “Tomorrow” performed by an energetic cast.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables: The Sequel (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning “Anne of Green Gables: the Sequel” continues the charming story of Anne Shirley, now an attractive and high spirited 18 year old teacher at Avonlea, whose life is brimming with romantic dreams, comic mishaps and adventure. Based on three books by Lucy Maud Montgomery: “Anne of Avonlea”, “Anne of the Island”, and “Anne of Windy Poplars”.

results.title: Anne of Green Gables (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Kevin Sullivan, Ian McDougall and Sullivan Films
results.brief_description: Artistically filmed amidst the spectacular scenery of Prince Edward Island, Canada, this award winning movie follows the provocative life drama of Anne Shirley, an endearing orphan, from her struggles as an adolescent to her triumphs as a young woman. Based on the novel “Anne of Green Gables” by Lucy Maud Montgomery, it stars Megan Follows and Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: Anne Frank remembered
results.creator_credit: Jon Blair, Disney Channel, BBC and Jon Blair Film Company
results.brief_description: Anne Frank has been described as one of the icons of the 20th century with her diary the second most read book of Western non-fiction after the Bible. Narrated by Kenneth Brannagh, with Glenn Close reading excerpts from the famous bestseller, John Blair’s film is effective in placing Anne’s story firmly in its 20th century context. This is not just her life in Holland and her death in a Nazi concentration camp, but the impact the diary has had in the half century since. Suitable for Upper Secondary level student, this packi includes a comprehensive study guide.

results.title: Anne Devlin
results.creator_credit: Pat Murphy, Tom Hayes, Arts Council of Great Britain, Irish Film Board, Bord Scannan na Heireann and Aeon Films
results.brief_description: From farmer’s daughter to political prisoner, Anne Devlin has remained on the periphery of formal history - hers is a history of kitchen and children, fetching and carrying, the quiet heroism of a woman who recovers and buries the dead, who withstands protracted torture. She speaks through the ‘lost’ diaries she kept while in prison. This is the second feature of Irishwoman Pat Murphy and the first all-Irish feature. Cast includes Brid Brennan and Bosco Hogan.
